paper_title: Construction of In<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub>@NH<sub>2</sub>-MIL-68(In)@In<sub>2</sub>S<sub>3</sub> Sandwich Homologous Heterojunction for Efficient CO<sub>2</sub> Photoreduction

paragraphs.paragraph_text: Photocatalytic conversion of CO 2 into fuel and value-added chemicals as a promising method has been applied recently to ease energy-or environment-related crises.Herein, we construct an In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In) In 2 S 3 (denoted as SMS(In)) sandwich homologous heterojunction via a controllable in situ metal-organic frameworks (MOF) sulfuration process.The improved photoreduction activity mainly lies in the effective charge transfer and separation through a homogeneous interface, enhanced CO 2 adsorption and mass transfer, and plentiful reactive sites.Benefiting from this unique hollow homologous heterojunction, SMS(In)-7 obtains a CO generation rate as high as 11.23 mol g -1 h -1 with visible-light irradiation, nearly 3 times enhancement over that of pure MOF-derived In 2 S 3 .This work provides a novel insight into the utilization of MOF-based platform for an efficient atomically heterojunction design.

annotations.source: Herein, we construct an In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In) In 2 S 3 (denoted as SMS(In)) sandwich homologous heterojunction via a controllable in situ metal-organic frameworks (MOF) sulfuration process.

Benefiting from this unique hollow homologous heterojunction, SMS(In)-7 obtains a CO generation rate as high as 11.23 mol g -1 h -1 with visible-light irradiation, nearly 3 times enhancement over that of pure MOF-derived In 2 S 3 .

paragraphs.paragraph_text: 2.2.2.Synthesis of In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In)In 2 S 3 .In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In)In 2 S 3 was synthesized using NH 2 -MIL-68(In) as a precursor.Briefly, 0.1 g of NH 2 -MIL-68(In) obtained in the previous step and 0.2 g of thiourea were mixed uniformly in 15 mL of anhydrous ethanol and the solution was added into a Teflon-lined autoclave (25 mL) and retained at 180 C for a certain time (2, 7, 9, 12, and 24 h).The solution was then cooled to room temperature and the obtained solid was collected through centrifugation and immersed in anhydrous ethanol at 60 C for 48 h and dried at 60 C.All of the In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In)In 2 S 3 heterostructures were synthesized and defined as SMS(In)-X (X 2, 7, 12, and 24, which represented the sulfuration times of 2, 7, 9, 12, and 24 h, respectively). 2.3.Characterization.The X-ray diffraction pattern was recorded on PANalytical X'Pert Powder with a Cu K radiation ( 0.15406 nm) at a voltage of 40 kV and current of 40 mA.Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy was performed with Bruker VERTEX 70.The morphologies and elemental composition were characterized by a field-emission scanning electron microscope (FESEM, HITACHI UHR FESEM SU8200) and a transmission electron microscope (TEM, PHILIPS TECNAI 10), respectively.CO 2 adsorption isotherms were collected on Micromeritics ASAP 2020.The products were degassed under vacuum conditions at 150 C for 6 h before measuring the CO 2 adsorption at 298 K. UV-vis diffused reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured by a UV-vis spectrophotometer (U-3900, HITACHI, Japan).The steadystate and transient fluorescence was carried out by a fluorescence spectrometer (FLS 980, Edinburgh, England) coupled with a time-correlated single photocounting system.The Mott-Schottky curves were obtained on an electrochemical workstation (CHI660D) with a three-electrode cell with Pt as a counter electrode, Ag/AgCl as a reference electrode, and an electrolyte (0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 aqueous solution at pH 7).A Scion 456 gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID) using a methanizer and a GC9790 Plus gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a TCD were utilized to analyze the gas products. 2.4.Photoreduction Procedure.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction was evaluated in an airtight glass reactor with a quartz top cap and a gas sampling port.Typically, 10 mg of photocatalyst, 45 mg of bipyridine (bpy), 60 L of CoCl 2 aqueous solution (54.6 mM), and 6 mL of the mixed reaction solution (V CH 3 CN /V TEOA 4:1) were mixed in a reactor.Then, the reactor was evacuated, and was purged with high purity CO 2 at a partial pressure of 0.1 MPa.This process was carried out several times to ensure that the reactor was full of pure CO 2 .The solution was irradiated with a 300 W xenon lamp (420 nm) with 400 mW cm -2 of light intensity (10.5 cm distance from the reaction solution).During irradiation, the reaction system was stirred and kept at a temperature of 15 C with a condenser circulation pump.The generated products were quantified every 2 h by a flame ionization detector (FID).

paragraphs.paragraph_text: In summary, In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In)In 2 S 3 (SMS(In)) sandwich homologous heterojunction with a hollow nanotube structure was designed and assembled by the controllable in situ sulfuration of NH 2 -MIL-68(In) for visible-light-driven CO 2 reduction.The subtle design not only maintained the original merits of NH 2 -MIL-68(In) but also endowed the composite material with dual interfacial homologous heterojunction shells, which showed enhanced adsorption and mass transfer of CO 2 , abundant reactive sites, and remarkably enhanced the separation and transfer efficiency of the photoinduced charge.As a consequence, the optimum sample (SMS(In)-7) exhibited outstanding photocatalytic activity for CO 2 reduction with a much more excellent CO generation rate (11.23 mol g -1 h -1 ), almost 3 times that of the pure MOFderived In 2 S 3 .This work proposes an instructive pathway for constructing an atomic MOF heterojunction for artificial photosynthesis.
